content.description: Undercling to a short mantle and topout on this small boulder
content.location: Just to the right of Easy Crack the obvious "tiny crack" with a boulder mantle on top

content.description: Start out on thin hand holds to the left of Easy Crack.  Work your way up and over.
content.location: Great slab line directly left of Easy Crack.  Descent same as with all other Easy Crack problems, walk down left side of Easy Crack.

content.description: Grab the better crimps to the left hand side  around or above head height. Pull onto the wall and traverse right through some decent crimps, some not so good crimps, and some cruddy feet. Eventually gaining the apex of the small crimps making a longer move up to slopers followed a powerful mantle.
content.location: If you are staring at easy crack there are 2 v6 problems to the right of easy crack and then a project (the blank rounded Arete) and then Samsara.

content.description: Hand traverse right and up to top out
content.location: Located to the right of easy crack. If looking at easy crack go right around the corner. to the right of Samsara.

content.description: This is it, the best wide crack in Georgia! great training for those who want to do the classic routes out west. Just climb the crack from a stand start (probably only V3) or from a sit start on fat hand jams. In case you are new to the technique of overhanging offwidths, the easiest way to do it is to do hang from fist-hand stacks and then jam a leg / foot / knee way up in the crack. Theres a good edge to stand on at half height and the top part is much easier. Wear long pants, long sleeves, and shoes big enough to wear socks under them and it shouldn't be much more painful then anything else at boat rock. Do it!
content.protection: a good spotter is a good idea because its not hard to get your foot / leg stuck if you are new to the technique.
content.location: Easy Crack Area. If you are looking at easy crack, go right trough a corridor, duck under a little boulder and you'll be right there.

content.description: Start on the same holds as easy crack traverse and go straight up from the big jug in the crack. Finish on the down climb slab
content.location: Left side of easy crack boulder

content.description: Start is the crux, most of the crack is easy cruising.  For photo see Easy Crack.
content.location: Located to the left of Easy Crack.  This is the popular traverse that starts at the far left and works up to the same topout as Easy Crack.  Seen it rated as V1 and V2.

content.description: Climb the crack using great jams.
content.location: In the Easy Crack Area.From the trail leading out of the parking lot, take your first right. It is located in the middle of the boulders slightly up hill.

content.description: Start from a crimp rail and work your way up and slightly right via a series of crimps.
content.location: To the left of Easy Crack and Easy Crack Traverse, just to the left of the area used to down climb the boulder.

content.description: Crux is getting to the crimpers and being able to pull down hard enough to establish yourself.
content.protection: pads.  There is a rock directly under this climb, and a tree also.
content.location: Route that is directly right of Easy Crack.

content.description: Hit "Improve This Page" to submit a description!
